discover: Discover the rich history and culture of Khiva
main_description: Established in 1970, Khiva Museum is a prestigious cultural and educational institution dedicated to preserving and showcasing the rich historical heritage of Khiva and its surrounding areas.
kaltaminor_title: KALTA MINOR – THE UNFINISHED SYMBOL OF KHIVA
Boy1: Khivan ceramics are known for their turquoise and cobalt-blue glaze, intricate patterns, and durability. These bowls, plates, and pitchers were commonly used in homes and madrassahs, often featuring floral or geometric designs typical of the Khorezm region’s aesthetic traditions.
Boy4: Silk ikat robes (chapan), embroidered headdresses, and handwoven belts were essential in the wardrobe of both everyday citizens and aristocrats. These garments reflected social status, regional identity, and local weaving mastery. Natural dyes and unique color combinations give each piece historical character.
Boy7: Explore swords, daggers, bows, and chainmail armor used by Khivan warriors, palace guards, and noblemen. These items not only served in defense but also demonstrated craftsmanship and social rank. Many weapons from this period were adorned with silver inlays and inscriptions, making them ceremonial as well as functional.
